article.headline: Yale 70, Fairfield 66
article.story: FAIRFIELD, Conn. (AP) -- Eric Flato hit all four of his free throws in the final 1:06 of overtime to lift Yale University to a 70-66 victory over Fairfield Tuesday night. Ross Morin led Yale (2-5) with 16 points as the Bulldogs snapped a five-game losing streak. Jordan Gibson had 14 points and Flato and Caleb Holmes each had 11. Greg Nero finished with a game-high 21 points and 10 rebounds for Fairfield (2-6). Warren Edney added 15 points for the Stags, who dropped their fourth straight game. Down 60-57 with 26.9 seconds remaining after a pair of free throws by Edney, Yale sent the game into overtime on Holmes' 3-pointer with 13.4 seconds left. Fairfield was trailing 68-66 when Edney slipped while driving to the basket with 13 seconds left. His turnover led to a pair of free throws Flato with 4.8 seconds left that sealed the victory. The Bulldogs led 31-26 at halftime. They had a five-point lead nearly three minutes into the second half, but the Stags went on a 12-0, taking a 42-35 lead on Nero's layup.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
